file_content.text: Shrine of Healing, huh? Pretty impressive for a medcenter.
The Shrine of Healing seems to be one of the primary Voss religious structures.
These people are very grounded, confident. I sense unfettered self-assurance from the Shrine of Healing. It calms me.
Shrine of Healing. Sounds therapeutic, serene. Idiots don't understand they're at war.
Weirdest medcenter I've ever seen. If I go down in battle, just let me die--do not bring me to these crazies.
Healing is for the weak.
There is much power in this place. Much feasting.
This is supposed to be the site of some kind of pilgrimage, right? So what do we do? Bow our heads and fold our hands?
The Shrine of Healing is a sacred place for the Voss. Try to be respectful.
Normally I don't have much interest in living cultures, but this "Shrine of Healing" is fascinating.
Let's see what those creeps keep in here, huh? "Shrine of Healing" my foot....
We should be honored to see the shrine. Few in this galaxy ever will.
Unusual architecture, but nothing technologically unique. Typical for their culture.
We toured the Sith ruins on Dromund Kaas when I was a child, but I've never seen an alien shrine. I'm quite excited.
Multiple life-forms detected inside. We may proceed.
Is it me or is this place actually kind of creepy for a Shrine of Healing? Maybe it's part of the whole "trials" mystique?
Not the most welcoming shrine I've ever seen. Then again, it sounds like they take a lot of pains to keep just anybody from wandering in.
Got a bad feeling. Something not quite natural. Don't think these trials are all talk.
This place where boss going to take test?
Don't see the big fuss about these little Voss runts, ain't got better things to do than sit around and scratch this junk on walls. Good for nothin'.
Put on your shiny shoes and get ready to play diplomat. I bet that's where the Voss bigwigs are.
The Tower of Prophecy, my lord, where the most powerful Mystics receive their visions.
This is a beautiful planet. I'll take it over the vaunted snowy mountains of Alderaan any day.
These people are too self-important. I hope the Empire appropriates and enslaves them.
Locked and loaded here. Say the word and that tower comes down.
More Voss in there. We don't like how they speak.
Pointless ornamentation. What a waste.
The Tower of Prophecy, huh. The Voss don't say much, but they sure build nice stuff.
The Tower of Prophecy. The center of Voss culture. Where the Mystics present their visions and the interpreters study. It's beautiful.
Unbelievable. That's--that's the Tower of Prophecy. Where the Voss interpret their visions! I wonder if they'll let me take samples from the walls.
There's the capitol. Different species, same show of power... Voss just think they're better than the rest.
Many Diplomatic Service members have been to Voss. Few have been inside the capitol.
There's something charmingly naive about building a capitol without orbital shields. At least we have options.
That must be the capitol. A quick peek couldn't hurt relations.
I have completed my analysis of Voss vulnerabilities and pain thresholds. I would like to choose a pair of the creatures for dissection.
I think that's the Tower of Prophecy over there. Imperial net says that's where most of the Voss Mystics spend their whole lives. Sounds more like a prison.
Nice view, maybe I'll retire up here. Build a little mansion on the edge, add a nice deck and sit sipping Corellian wine. What do you think?
City's been expanded on recently. Notice all the Imperial and Republic construction? Bribes.
Voss place make Blizz nose itch.
Nice place. All clean and peaceful. When we gonna trash it?
Now, that is one big gun. I guess if size matters, the Gormak win, huh?
The Gormak clearly have technical skill and sophisticated arms. They may not be the simple savages the Voss make them out to be.
Such a wanton culture. The Gormak are ready for war, master.
I think I like the Gormak. Any culture that flexes its muscles like this is okay by me. The hatred for Force users is unfortunate but still, good people on the whole.
Pretty sweet cannon they got there. Wouldn't mind seeing its blast effect. Through macrobinoculars, of course.
Big guns are no match for our claws!
These Gormak creatures carry the faint scent of the Force.

These guys mean business, huh. Haven't seen a cannon like that since a buddy of mine stole an experimental dematerializer off the black market. That thing looks like it'd take a good chunk out of Voss-Ka if they had a mind to fire it.
Let's hope the Gormak don't decide to fire that thing. It's pointed right at Voss-Ka, and it looks like it could do real damage.
That is a very large gun. I hope we're not on Voss-Ka when they decide to fire it.
Nice gun. Nasty recoil. Think I can handle it.
The Gormak don't seem to think small. We know they're contained, but... in a thousand years, what will they do?
Gormak technology really is fascinating. What I wouldn't give for a long talk with their engineers.
That thing's large enough to bring down starships. The Gormak are more dangerous than we thought.
The Gormak are socially primitive, but their technology is worthy of study and integration. I will begin to upgrade.
Oh my--look at that thing! The Gormak could probably blow Voss-Ka right off the mountain with that!
How'd you like that mounted on the ship, eh? A little flashy for that junker of yours, but style isn't one of your strong points anyway.
Some artillery. Any idea what tech that's using? Not a blaster cannon, that's for sure.
Oh! Oh! Boss! Boss take Blizz to see big tech thing?
Oh yeah, can't wait to get my hands on that. I say we blast that little city right off the mountain and get off this borin' rock.
Did I ever tell you I have a fear of dying at the hands of a dark alien presence?
I don't like this, my lord. A tactical assessment of what we're up against in here is impossible.
Unrestrained and sinister darkness resides here. My blood goes cold.
Such darkness here. I've never felt such pure concentrated hatred. It's awe-inspiring.
Glad I restocked and juiced up--have a feeling I'm gonna need a full load for this place.
There is no light here--darkness reigns! We feel at home!
The throbbing heart of impenetrable darkness. Glorious.
I'm not saying I'm scared or nothing, but this "Dark Heart" isn't the kind of place I want to stick around. Anything that scares both the Voss and the Gormak is bad news.
This is an evil place, full of dark side energy. You are powerful, my lord, but I'm not sure even you are strong enough for this place. No wonder the Voss and the Gormak fear it.
This must be what the Voss call the "Dark Heart." Such fascinating ruins. And to think, I never would have seen them if it weren't for you.
There's something really messed up about this place. Like the Dark Temple all over again.
We see things in the shadows, agent. We hear something like a scream....
This place is old, Cipher. Much older than it should be, given what we've seen of the Voss.
Sir, something feels... off here. I can't explain it, I just--I think we should go back.
Your life readings are fluctuating. The Nightmare Lands phenomenon is worth further examination.
Yeugh... something just ran up my spine.
I don't see what all the fuss is about.
Reminds me of Dromund Kaas.
Ick, dusty!
Just got that warm fuzzy feelin', like bathin' in blood.
Shrine of Healing = Voss sacred site // T7 = promises not to touch anything
This place makes the hairs on my neck stand up--and not in a good way. Don't know about you, but the Voss give me the shivers.
I don't go in for this Voss Mystic healing business, but I do admire the architecture here.
I held a single-entrance fortress similar to this on Amador. Enemy bodies were stacked twenty-high around the outside when that battle was over.
The shrine radiates power. The Force is strong here.
Is power here, but not of blood and hunt.
I'll say this for the Voss: That spiritual nonsense of theirs translates to beautiful architecture.
We don't belong here. This is a Voss place.
I almost feel like I should leave my weapons behind. This is no place for soldiers.
This looks... old. Much older than anything in Voss-Ka. Do you think it was always a shrine?
This Shrine of Healing is really something. Must have taken forever to build.
Trees on Voss are tiny. Bowdaar misses Kashyyyk.
Wonder what sort of treasures the Voss are sitting on in there. Not that I advocate stealing....
A foolish location for a place of healing. One could die just getting here. Perhaps that's the point.
My Force powers go all tingly here. That's never happened before!
Must be the Shrine of Healing. Pretty impressive--I can see why the Voss are so proud of it.
The Shrine of Healing. A very important landmark according to our data on the Voss.
The Voss Shrine of Healing. It is highly valued by the local citizenry, so it must be highly valued by us.
So that's the Shrine of Healing, huh? Not bad, not bad at all. These Voss can really build 'em.
The Shrine of Healing. Yuun wonders at the mysteries of this place.
Voss-Ka = neutral territory // Conflict between Republic + Empire = discouraged by Voss
Voss is a lot prettier than I expected. Sure beats the last few places we've been.
You finally brought me someplace nice. Look--shops and restaurants. Things worth fighting over.
This is Republic-friendly territory, sir. The Imperials have their own zone nearby. I recommend we keep our distance from it.
Your Republic begs favors from the Voss here. A pointless pursuit. These people are aggressively self-interested.
Voss are... strange. Not hunters, not prey.
Voss-Ka really is quite lovely. A little quiet for my tastes.
Voss invited the Empire in. Deserve all they get when it goes bad.
Best smiles on for the Voss, everybody....
The trees, the people... Voss-Ka's so much like home. How long can we stay?
I hear the Voss locals are a strange bunch. Probably best to leave them alone.
The air on Voss is clean. Bowdaar approves.
I've heard the Voss don't enforce Republic laws. People are free to do what they want, as long as they leave the Voss alone. My kind of place.
The Voss say they have great warriors. I look forward to testing that claim.
An associate of mine says Voss is a place where almost anything goes. The natives haven't even outlawed spice.
So this is Voss? Beautiful place. I'd heard stories, but I never thought I'd actually come here.
This world is quite striking. I've read that the Voss have very impressive medical techniques--I'll have to look into it.
A beautiful world! We must do all that we can to defend it against Imperial degradation.
Nice place, even if I've never heard of it. I can get why people might want a piece of it.
Yuun sees many signs, many paths. This world has seen much, and will see more.
Cannon = advanced technology // Gormak = built it themselves?
Nice gun. You could put a city out with that thing. Wish it wasn't aimed at Voss-Ka.
Apparently, the Gormak spent everything they had building the nicest, biggest gun on Voss.
Advanced artillery like that shouldn't belong to savages. If we can't take that position, our only recourse is to destroy it.
A giant gun. How crude. These Gormak have little imagination in their choice of weapons.
Cowardly to fight from afar. Not even smell enemy's blood.
The Gormak truly are ingenious. Homicidal, but ingenious.
Gormak weaponry. That's got to go.
Sheesh. Look at the bore on that monster. It could blow a building clean in half.
All those resources, all that time and skill, and they make a weapon. What a waste!
Look at the size of that cannon the Gormak built. I gotta get me one of those.
Bowdaar does not fear that weapon.
This cannon explains everything. The Gormak have an inferiority complex--and they're prepared to blow up Voss-Ka to improve their self-esteem.
Your starship would benefit from having such a weapon mounted to the hull. It would discourage pirates.
That is one big cannon. Makes me nervous just being near it.
Whoa. That's some serious artillery. Let's hope we don't have to find out if it works.
Look at the size of that cannon... the Gormak are clearly more advanced than our intelligence indicates.
An impressively constructed artillery piece, to be sure. My sensors detect several inefficiencies, however.
Now that's a cannon! Can we take it with us? The Voss won't mind, right?
Such impressive ingenuity, turned to such negative purpose.
T7 = analyzing remains // Bones = large beasts + Voss + Gormak + "other"
Most people would just put up a "do not disturb" sign. Whatever awful thing lives here doesn't do things halfway.
Once you get past the giant piles of bones, this place isn't that bad. Oh, who am I kidding?
Nice of the enemy to advertise its location. Let's take care of business.
I sense a familiar presence. If I did not know better, I'd think the Emperor had been here.
Cave calls challenge to us, Herald.
Jedi, something tells me that cave is not to be trifled with. Let's just keep going.
Don't like turning my back on that cave. Something's in there.
My old sergeant used to say, some places watch you. And that cave? That's watching us right now.
Back home, we call caves like that "mouths of the hidden." In the old stories, they speak with the voices of the dead. In... stories.
Look at all those bones, Captain. Whatever lives down here must have a blasted huge appetite.
A great predator nests here.
Let's not get ourselves added to those piles of bones. Keep your eyes open down here.
Bones of the dead. Someone here enjoys displaying trophies.
That's an awful lot of bones. Say, I just remembered an important appointment back on the ship....
Looks like a lot of stuff ends up dying around this cave, sir. Let's make sure we're not next.
Whatever is in that cave, the remains scattered about are too numerous to count. We should be cautious.
Biological remains detected in all directions. The cave seems to be the source--let's investigate!
I don't know about this place, boss. Something in that cave has been doing a lot of killing.
Signs of danger and darkness surround us in this place.
Complaint: The Shrine of Healing... so this is where the Voss undo all my hard work.
Analysis: The Tower of Prophecy, indeed. I predict I will soon be annoyed by a Voss.
Insight: Whatever their faults, at least the Gormak are honest about their intentions. Witness Exhibit A.
Revelation: My scanners indicate all manner of undesirables in various states of emotional distress. It's like coming home.
Hypothesis: Would it be unethical to delete Imperial troublemakers while under Voss care?
Judgment: Voss has primitive architecture and miniscule resources. Why do we seek their favor?
Truism: Size matters. The Gormak clearly understand this.
Observation: Several mass deletions occurred here, master. We always visit the most exciting places.
